title: Spaceballs
content:
has anybody seen this star trek/star wars parody?

title: Re: Spaceballs
content:
Yes, me.

Its absolutely brilliant, wasn't it a Mel Brooks film?

Pure comedy all the way through.

title: Re: Spaceballs
content:
Yeah, it seems to be written, directed, and starred by Brooks.
Never seen it, although I was once about to borrow it and see..
So, I've seen the dvd package.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: heh
content:
*Dark Helmet gives the command*
Fire a warning shot... across her nose.
*shots are fired; they strike the ship*
I said across her nose, not up it!
*gunner turns around, his eyes are crossed*
Sorry, sir. Doing my best.
*Dark Helmet is not pleased*
Who hired this man?
*camera pans to an officer, equally crosseyed*
I did sir. He's my cousin.
*Dark Helmet is less pleased*
Who is that man?
*2nd in command chimes in*
He's an Asshole, sir--
*Dark Helmet interrupts*
--I know that--
*2nd in command continues*
No, sir, that's his name. Asshole. Major Phillip Asshole.
*Dark Helmet ponders this for a moment*
...How many Assholes we got on this ship?
*many of the soldiers working on the bridge rise and salute*
SIR!
*Dark Helmet is shocked*
I knew it! I'm surrounded by Assholes!
*Dark Helmet pulls his mask down, which deepens his voice*
Keep firing, Assholes!

:-) I know I didn't get it word-for-word, but that is by far my favorite extended gag in a movie.

Spaceballs was the only movie I had in the house one summer I was staying at my dad's house... I think we watched it every day for two months. :-( I can't watch it anymore.

title: Re: heh
content:
Yeah, you forgot when the second crosseyed man is described as A first gunner major, Asshole.

I also like:

*A guy is sitting in front of a radar screen, the radar noises stop, and are then replaced by a hiss.*

Guy: hsssssssssshhit! [He was making the noise]
Guy: *muffled through intercom* Sir?
*2nd in command* Yes, what is it private?
Guy *muffled through intercom* I'm having some trouble with the radar sir
*2nd in command* YWhat?
Guy *muffled through intercom* I'm having some trouble with the radar sir
*Dark helmet snatches intercom off* You don't need that private, we're right here
Guy: *still using intercom voice* I'm having troubble with the radar sir!
*Dark helemt smashes the intercom*
Guy *normal* I'm having troubble with the radar sir, I've lost the bleeps, the sweeps, and the creeps!
2nd IC: The what, the what and the what?
Guy You know, the beeps; bop-boo-bop, the sweeps; shhhssshhss, and the creeps; beewooewwooop.

title: Re: heh
content:
Brooks has a couple of good parodies.. the best of them being that of Shelley's horror story. Try to get a hold on Young Frankenstein (starring Gene Wilder & Marty Feldman) if you can. Best horror comedy ever.<hr>

title: Re: heh
content:
Spaceballs is a CLASSIC!

I say to anyone who hasn't seen it yet:

"GO SEE IT!"
